name: MBTI Test
description: Find your type in less than 15 minutes using our quick test. Mark the extent to which you agree or disagree with the statements below. Try to avoid marking "Neutral."

descriptions: You're oriented toward the world around you. You draw energy from activity, people, and objects, and you might find that you think best when discussing with others. Of course, there are times where you feel sapped of energy from spending too long around others. But the reverse is also true: too much time spent alone leaves you craving connection and action.

You prefer to interact with the world around you: taking action, meeting people, trying things hands-on. You think best when discussing ideas with others, and, while you might enjoy alone time to decompress, you find that doing things or connecting with people often propels you forward.

You're oriented toward the world around you. Rather than dwell on ideas or reflections, you prefer to be out there, connecting with people, taking action, and interacting with the world. After long periods alone, you might feel sapped of the energy that rushes through you when you spend time doing and connecting.

A slight preference toward introversion doesn't mean that you aren't social: In fact, you may cultivate strong friendships due to your ability to offer fresh thoughts from your reflections. Rather, it means you tend to draw energy from quiet time rather than from people, objects, or activities per se. You might enjoy spending time with others, especially close friends who you feel you can be yourself with, though you might find yourself craving some time to re-charge after a marathon of social events.

You tend to draw energy from time to yourself. This doesn't mean you're antisocial or unfriendly: Instead, your energy is more directed toward the world of reflection and ideas than people or objects. This often gives you a unique outlook on your surroundings, and you might seek out strong one-on-one friendships with others who see the world the same way you do.

You prefer personal space for reflection, thinking and dreaming to the hustle and bustle of the world around you. You find long social engagements draining and less worth your time than reading a good book, playing a video game, or otherwise giving yourself personal space to decompress.

questions.text: I find that I brainstorm best by discussing my ideas with others
I like to pack my weekends with social engagements
I feel at ease in big cities
I find it thrilling to meet new people
I find it easy to be vulnerable with others
I often make new connections at events or outings
After a long day, I prefer to recharge by watching TV, reading a book, or playing video games alone
I find that I brainstorm best when able to think about a problem on my own for a while
My friends would describe me as 'reflective.'
I have as much fun doing something alone as I would doing it with others
I prefer to spend time with friends one-on-one rather than in a large group
I find spending long hours at work or with friends draining
I enjoy thinking through theoretical ideas and frameworks
I easily find connections between very different fields of study or jobs
I easily grasp metaphors and symbols while reading
I often think about the meaning of life
I tend to think about the root cause for phenomena
I sometimes trust principles and metaphors more than my actual experience
I work best with managers who give clear and prescriptive instructions
Experience is a better indicator of future success than creativity
I find it much harder to learn things from reading or hearing about them than from doing them hands-on
I prefer to learn practical and applied skills over abstract ideas
I gravitate towards jobs where I can use my hands
When putting together a report or presentation, I have a knack for paying close attention to detail
I am likely to use logical and impartial criteria to make a decision
It is more important to be truthful than tactful
My friends would call me 'stubborn' or 'strong-headed'
I often weigh the pros and cons of a decision before I make it
I enjoy fields like engineering and science with clear, objective criteria
I am not easily swayed by others' wishes
I have a knack for being able to read a room
I am diplomatic
When friends are going through a tough time, I tend to offer sympathy rather than advice
I think compassion is more important than justice
I tend to compromise easily if it helps maintain harmony
I find it difficult to be angry with others, even when I don't agree with their choices
I like to carefully plan each day of a vacation to get the most out of it
I often make to-do lists of my priorities for the day
I plan my work in advance so that I easily meet deadlines
I like routine
I feel uneasy when I haven't yet made a decision about an upcoming plan
I prefer to get my work done before play
I work in bursts of energy
I think thorough planning is likely to ruin a good vacation
I rarely hesitate before jumping into new experiences
I am often late
My friends would call me 'impulsive' or 'spontaneous'
I think the best decision is one that keeps my options open
